commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed chatbot, greets user and exits.
commitResults.messageBody:
Removed all traces of old name and replaced with "Milo".
Initial skeletal version implemented via System.out.println.

Milo now echoes commands entered by the user, and
exits when the user says "bye".

Chatbot now stores input given by user
and displays it back to the user
when "list" is entered.

Integrate Task class and allow users
to mark and unmark tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tasks can now only be added using Todo, Deadline, Event
commitResults.messageBody:
Also implement date and time for Deadline
and Event.

Test typical user commands to reduce
need for manual testing.

Throw error when command format
is incorrect.

Add support for deleting
tasks from the list.

Incorporate TaskType and Status enums
and organised files in src code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Save and load tasks to disk on exit
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks in the chatbot are not persistent across sessions. Users
have to re-enter tasks everytime the chatbot starts.

Let's update Milo to read tasks from the hard disk when it starts
and write all changes back to the file when the user types "bye"
or exits.

This ensures that the task list is preserved between sessions,
but note that changes are only saved at the end of the session,
not whenever the task list is updated.

commitResults.messageTitle: Save tasks to disk immediately after changes
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks were only saved to the hard disk when the user exited
the chatbot with "bye". Any changes during the session were
lost if the program unexpectedly terminates.

Let's update Milo to save task list immediately after
any changes are made, ensuring data loss is minimised
and keeping tasks up-to-date in real time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Task list: fix numbering after deletion
commitResults.messageBody:
When a task is deleted, the numbering shown
by the 'list' command skips the removed task,
resulting in non-sequential numbering
(e.g. 1, 2, 4, 5 if task 3 was removed).

This is confusing for users and breaks
the expectation that task numbers are always contiguous.

Let's update the list command to that numbering
is always sequential.

commitResults.messageTitle: Task dates: parse and store date and time
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, dates are stored as Strings.

This makes it harder to process or display
dates in a consistent format.

Let's parse Deadline and Event date and time
inputs into actual date and time that
can be understood by the chatbot.

As an aside, add a new 'reset' command to
clear all tasks from the list.

Using LocalDateTime instead of Strings enables
future features such as listing tasks by date
or sorting tasks chronologically.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add commands: sort, show and help
commitResults.messageBody:
Users currently cannot check tasks
by date, sort them in chronological
order, or discover all available
commands easily.

Let's,
* add 'sort' to arrange tasks chronologically
* add 'show <yyyy-MM-dd>' to display tasks for
a specific date
* add 'help' to list available commands

Extract user interaction, file I/O, and parsing
logic into separate classes (Ui, Storage, Parser).
Create TaskList to encapsulate task operations.
Introduce Command classes.

This improves separation of concerns, simplifies
the main application of logic, and makes it
easier to extend with new commands in future.

Group classes into packages for better structure:
* command: Command classes
* storage: Storage and file I/O
* enums: shared enums
* exception: custom exceptions
* logic: Parser logic
* model: TaskList, Task, Deadline, Event, Todo
* ui: User display

Improves modularity, readability.

Add Checkstyle configuration.
Configure application plugin
with mainClass set to Milo.

Add JUnit tests to test valid and edge
cases for Task.makeTask, as well as
invalid and valid file lines in
Storage.readFile. Ensure
exceptions are thrown for
malformed or missing data.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc to methods and classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Improves readability and
maintainability of code by
providing clear documentation
for all methods and classes.

Reformat code to comply with
Checkstyle rules.

The search is case-sensitive.

This improves task retrieval and user
convenience.

commitResults.messageTitle: Enforce Checkstyle and clean up code
commitResults.messageBody:
Some parts of the codebase
did not fully adhere to Checkstyle
rules. There were also typos in
code and comments, and a few
variables that were unused or
irrelevant.

Let's fix the style violations,
correct the typos, and remove
unused variables. This improves
code readability, maintainability,
and ensures consistent coding
standards across the project.

Set up the main window and dialog
components using JavaFX controls.
This connects the UI to the Milo
backend.
